title: 114_hr5681
content: The Act titled "Alzheimer's Beneficiary and Caregiver Support Act" mandates testing of Medicare and Medicaid coverage for Alzheimer's disease caregiver support services. The Social Security Act is amended to include a model for Alzheimer's disease caregiver support services, to be implemented within one year of enactment. The Social Security Act is amended to include a model for Alzheimer's disease caregiver support services, to be implemented within one year of enactment. The Secretary will test the coverage and payment for Alzheimer's Disease caregiver support services for a 3-year period starting on January 1, 2018, to delay or reduce institutionalized care for Medicare beneficiaries. The term 'Alzheimer's Disease caregiver support services' refers to specific services. The caregiver support services include a defined set of counseling sessions over a fixed period of time, followed by follow-up assessments, support group participation, and ad hoc counseling to support the family caregiver as needed. The caregiver support services offer counseling sessions, follow-up assessments, and support group participation for family caregivers of Medicare beneficiaries with Alzheimer's Disease or related dementia. An eligible professional for caregiver intervention in Alzheimer's Disease must be a clinical social worker or nurse practitioner with extensive online training. A family caregiver is defined as a spouse, adult child, or other family member of a Medicare beneficiary with Alzheimer's Disease or related dementia. The Secretary will establish payment amounts for Alzheimer's Disease caregiver support services, ensuring that primary family caregivers and at least one other informal family caregiver of applicable Medicare beneficiaries receive these services.
